numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph measures a percentage.
2. The percentage is about people who are 18-34 years old.
3. These people do not live with a parent.
4. These people say that they reach out to a parent at least once a day or a few times a week.
5. The graph compares young men and young women.
6. The graph compares methods of communication with parents.
7. In general, young women have a higher percentage of reaching out to parents than young men have.
8. For young women, sending texts is the most popular means of communication.
9. For young men, sending texts is the most popular means of communication.
10. For young women, visiting in person is the least popular means of communication.
11. For young men, visiting in person is the least popular means of communication.
12. Sending texts requires less time than visiting in person.
13. Sending texts requires less effort than visiting in person.
14. Because of this, sending texts is easier than visiting in person.
15. Young adults have busy daily schedules.
16. Because of this, young adults can quickly send a text.
17. The difference in percentage between young men and young women is the lowest for visiting in person.
18. The difference in percentage between young men and young women is higher for phone or video-chat than for visiting in person.
19. The difference in percentage between young men and young women is higher for sending texts than for visiting in person.
20. This relates to my community.
21. I know some people in college.
22. These people do not live with their parents now.
23. It is often difficult for these people to find time to contact their families.
24. These people try to text their families as much as they can.
25. These people try to call their families as much as they can.
26. The headline is: Connecting Back Home - Is Contacting Parents a Priority?
